<< full sparse type nnz >>

IJV

Returns I,J,V triplets from a sparse matrix.

Syntax

[iv, jv, vv, m, n, nnz] = IJV(sp)

Input argument

sp

a sparse matrix.

Output argument

iv

a vector: row indices of the nonzero elements.

jv

a vector: column indices of the nonzero elements.

vv

a vector: values of the nonzero elements.

m

an integer value: number of rows in the matrix.

n

an integer value: number of columns in the matrix.

nnz

an integer value: number of non zeros elements.

Description

IJV converts a sparse matrix into its COO format.

Example

sp = sparse(eye(3,3))
[IV, JV, VV, m, n, nnz] = IJV(sp)

See also

sparse.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
